website_summaries.verdict: A popular electric chainsaw that delivers excellent value for the money.
pros: Low-cost electric chainsaw with many features found on more expensive machines
cons: A few reliability issues reported by owners (though owner maintenance could be a factor)

website_summaries.verdict: Powerful enough for small commercial jobs, this model is also practical for households with heavier than normal cutting needs, making this a good option for users who need a tool for both work and home use.
pros: One advantage to corded chainsaws is the additional power over a battery-powered model
The 14.5 amps produced by this unit offers enough cutting power for even very thick limbs
Cuts through trunks of moderate thickness
Works for commercial or ranch work
Compact and portable enough for trimming overgrown or dangerous limbs on household properties
cons: Some users report that this model uses oil more quickly than might be expected

customer_reviews.title: Bought in late December, haven't had a chance to ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought in late December, haven't had a chance to use it until today--dealing with a downed tree from major windstorm--and the darn thing doesn't turn on. The troubleshooting section of the manual says check cords--which of course and did. Then it says replace cord on the saw...elsewhere it says only the factory should replace cord...Duh. It's Saturday, yes, but this outfit should be big enough for 24/7. This is a hassle which I probably deserve for going chinese, but....just beware.
customer_reviews.author: stuffwrangler

customer_reviews.title: Complete disappointment. After 20 minutes of use cutting logs (plenty ...
customer_reviews.text: Complete disappointment. After 20 minutes of use cutting logs (plenty of chain lube, no dirt, rocks, metal on cutting surface) the blade would no longer cut. Worx replaced the chain with an item of equal poor quality. Same problem - no cutting after about 20 minutes of appropriate use. Refused to supply a third chain. This product was rated well by Consumer Reports but I have found it to be a source of aggravation and a waste of time and money. I suggest you purchase something else.
customer_reviews.author: Retired ED MD

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good But-
customer_reviews.text: - has its problems. My saw pretty much falls in line with other complaints. While it appears to be a rare one NOT leaking from the oil reserve, its chain did come loose after only making a half dozen cuts of a four inch limb. The chain seemed dull nearly from the start and had a nasty habit of cramming debris into the drive gear housing after that same initial exercise, which also absorbed and blocked proper dispensing from the auto-oiler, making the bar smoke after only seconds of work from lack of lube. Obviously I should've learned my lesson from a WORX lawn edger, which went up in smoke after less than a full season's moderate work.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Koz.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts great BUT chain oil leakage TOTALLY SUCKS!
customer_reviews.text: Compared to my old saw, this one cuts great. It's well balanced and the chain that came with it was very sharp. BUT --- ALL the chain oil leaks out when it's sitting on the shelf. The very first time you go out to your shed and have to clean up the oily, nasty, disgusting mess you'll wish you never bought this saw. NOT RECOMMENDED UNTIL THEY FIX THE OIL LEAKAGE ISSUE.
customer_reviews.author: Johng

customer_reviews.title: Leaks oil brand new
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure of its cutting ability, Have not used but once. So I really can't say one way or the other. But upon adding the necessary oil, it immediately leaked. Right on the workbench. Thought maybe it might leak a little so put it under the workbench. It has stayed there.
customer_reviews.author: T. Neill

customer_reviews.title: Awesome chainsaw. Cut up the trunk of a cedar ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome chainsaw. Cut up the trunk of a cedar tree that was damaged in a storm. At least 2 ft in diameter. Great power, but it can go through some bar and chain oil. Don't mess with the 1 quart bottles. Just buy a gallon jug for $7.50 at Walmart and keep an eye on the see through indicator. Use generously. Would recommend this chainsaw to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: K. S.

customer_reviews.title: Good, but a couple issues
customer_reviews.text: This is a great chainsaw for the money, but there are a couple of issues which lower my rating. First, it wants a very thin chain and bar oil. 30w oil or thinner. The standard bar oil is much too thick. It doesn't lubricate the bar and chain so the wear is accelerated greatly. Second, the automatic chain tensioner can get clogged and non-functional. This happened to me cutting up very fiberous wood (a big Yucca). The tensioner clogged and the chain became very slack. Hanging down below the bar. Luckily I saw it before it flew off and injured me. This happened twice so it was not a random thing.
customer_reviews.author: AMR

customer_reviews.title: Better than gas if your use is ocassonal
customer_reviews.text: I have had gas saws and they are great but I seldom need one so they sit up a lot and then I can't start them. I have used this saw with 250' of 12g power cord and off a generator. Pull the trigger and it runs with little noise. This week I have been cutting up oak limbs that are so thick only about an inch of the blade sticks through. It cuts as fast as any gas saw I have used. This is not rotten oak either. The auto chain tensioning is wonderful. I bought my daughter one and she has cut up several full size pecan trees with hers. Neither has worn out yet.
customer_reviews.author: Bow Bender

customer_reviews.title: Hard working tool
customer_reviews.text: Was a little concerned that an electric chainsaw would not have the power I needed, but it worked great. Had two 50 foot Eucalyptus trees cut down (with a bigger, stronger gas saw) but this 16" electric Worx made hundreds of cuts in the last month to delimb and buck the wood. I was impressed. Thankful I didn't have to mess with a gas engine. If you can get electricity to your work, I recommend this saw. The safety brake works a little hard, the plastic casing is home owner grade plastic, and I went thru 2 chains, but it did all that was asked of it.
customer_reviews.author: p22345

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Saw
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time last night and love it. I don't expect to cut down any big trees with this but if used for cutting up brush and trimming tree limbs, this chainsaw works great. Don't get overly aggressive with this or the chain will pop off which happened one time with me. Let the chainsaw do the work, don't try to force it. The only reason this did not get a 5 was the instructions did not tell me how to get the chain cover off and I had to ask Google. To save some of you the trouble, unscrew the auto-tension knob. It is just a screw on the end
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it once, but it performed better than I expected. I have two gas powered chainsaws and an electric pole saw. Both gas powered chainsaws need to be rebuilt. My electric pole saw has been such a strong performer that I chose to go with this saw for the bigger jobs. Cost of the saw was most likely less than what it would cost to replace the pull cord, the primer button, and whatever else would need replacement. I chose to go with electric over battery because I did not want to run out of battery power while working. The inconvenience of plugging in the extension cord is well worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Cs

customer_reviews.title: Best little big saw
customer_reviews.text: It is so easy to operate and I absolutely love this chainsaw.had the same brand before and never was dissapointed.im 71 years old this is a piece of cake.it took some time to get the chain on properly to get it to work.kept flinging off.just keep at it itll work.now that it has run some I wont have the trouble with chain.watch the oil.its important as this saw will e as t the oil but that is actually good wont run dry. I have cut trees with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: glfaircloth

customer_reviews.title: Even Tim "the tool man" Taylor couldn't help
customer_reviews.text: I've got a lot of small trees (1-6 inches) on my property so I thought this would be great. The reviews seemed generally positive and the price was great. When it came it seem heavy duty enough to deal with the trees I wanted to clear, easy to assemble and use. The power however just isn't there. I took me almost 4 minutes to cut through a 1.5 inch sapling (yes I sharpened the blades first) A pair of hand pruners worked better. Kinda sorry I got it.
customer_reviews.author: flattops united

customer_reviews.title: Used this saw twice. Once when I received it ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this saw twice. Once when I received it 2yrs ago just to make sure it worked and today. A total of 4 cuts through a 10" log and the motor started shooting flames and smoke out of the end cap and then it died. It seemed to be cutting impressively well. Lots of power then 'POOF"! EDIT: I've upgrade my rating because the company is going to help me fix saw. Awesome! For those who are not aware you have to register your product within the first 30days to get the 3yr warranty. Without registration you get 2yr warranty which is still pretty good IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant surprise
customer_reviews.text: My last electric chainsaw was a sears 14 amp. It lasted 30 years. I use it to reduce logs I bring in for firewood to stove length. Much handier than gas for this purpose . Cuts 14" oak easily. It is very powerful for a light duty gas or electric. I did not expect a plastic saw to match my old one. The tensioner wheel is a nice gimmick that seems to work. Time will tell. Chain was sharp on delivery. Summer weight chain oil seems too heavy as it's not using much at all. A surprise pick at under $100.
customer_reviews.author: Homer

customer_reviews.title: A little champ
customer_reviews.text: You don't expect much from a small, inexpensive chain saw like this, but I'm definitely getting my money's worth. I've taken down 2 trees (5-6 inches in diameter) and trimmed up several more. There's a third tree awaiting it's demise, and this chain saw will be the executioner. I wasn't expecting it to arrive requiring assembly, but the instructions were pretty clear. It took only a few minutes. Be sure to really tighten the chain, though; first time I used it, the chain slipped off.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Ivie

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because we have Bradford pear trees which starting to experience broken branches. The trees are about 15 years old and they have long branches. I've been able to cut two 20-ft branches with ease. It came with a small bottle of oil which was enough for the first branch and some of the second. Recommends purchasing more oil when you order the chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Never worked. Put it together, plugged it in ...
customer_reviews.text: Never worked. Put it together, plugged it in, and nothing... Sadly, I'm two days out from returning, or I'd send it back... If they're warranty department steps up, I'll remove this review for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Comstock

customer_reviews.title: Too easy
customer_reviews.text: Was told I shouldn't use my chainsaws anymore due to age and health. I live in the country and heat with wood so I decided to give electric a try. Awesome!!!! Light weight, quiet, and no hard cranking. Just don't get excited and cut through the cord as I did the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Old Man

customer_reviews.title: Very smooth!
customer_reviews.text: I will start by saying I have never used a chainsaw. The instructions were not super clear and it just had pictures for assembly I would have liked some written instructions. I ended up putting the chain on incorrectly, which is why I was struggling a bit. After the first small branch, I realized it should not be that difficult and double checked/fixed the chain situation. Once I fixed it, it was smooth sailing! I was able to cut down a pine tree (8 inches in diameter) like butter. It was so easy I decided to cut some "slices" (see pics) to make some crafts with my kids.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Wentworth

customer_reviews.title: VERY Good Saw
customer_reviews.text: A very good saw. Customer Service gave good advice (I may have missed it in the owner's manual): after using, loosen and retighten the cap on the chain oil tank, to release pressure and avoid leakage during storage. Also, store the saw in horizontal position to avoid oil leakage. If storing it vertically as I do, I suggest draining the oil tank. The saw served us very well in storm clean-up. The supplied chain is of good quality. Let the saw do the work, without forcing it into the cut. The saw has plenty of power. Overall, a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Good Business

customer_reviews.title: Chain oiler doesn't work well.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the saw. It works well is light and powerful. I never thought the chain oiler was working well when I used it the first time. After leaving it over the winter the oiler quit working altogether. I took it apart and tried to clean it but I never could see any oil on the chain. It must be clogged but I can't figure out how to remove the clog. I used bar chain oil so I don't think it was the oil that clogged it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Oil NOT Included
customer_reviews.text: I don't care if the oil for this chainsaw is not included...IF you mention this in the product description listing. I don't mind buying oil separately (which I did once I saw a review that stated oil not included). I am not expecting a gallon of oil, just enough to get started. The chainsaw is excellent. Very easy to assemble, quiet, well balanced. Works very well, chopped up a 20' tree easily. The chainsaw is recommended, don't forget to buy the oil separately.
customer_reviews.author: matt8386

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best of the corded electric small saws that I've purchased over the years. I prefer to use them when cutting up brush and branches on the ground into firewood. Saves gas and pollutes a whole lot less. This one has adequate power for cutting up stuff up to about 12 inches in diameter or so. I have two of them, and they've held up very well. Of course, if you don't sharpen the chain or remember to keep bar oil in it, you'll be whining in no time when it burns up. There's no such thing as a maintenance free chainsaw, and an electric one is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Gu

customer_reviews.title: It worked great for a while.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chainsaw here on Amazon.com. It worked great for sometime. I was able to cut medium size trees with ease. This weekend I tried to use it but it stopped working all together, I called WORX customer service and said they would send me a new one. I offered to send it faulty item back so they could investigate the issue. They said to keep it for parts. I am leaving 5 starts because WORX customer service was great. It might be just this item, but overall the chainsaw is solid, appeared quality.
customer_reviews.author: NJPE

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I needed a chainsaw that I could just pick up and run, without messing around with fuel mix, bar oil, and the rest of the routine that comes with my gasoline powered chainsaw. I thought I would try this saw, and it had great reviews. I was cutting some dead wild cherry trees in my yard, with limbs exceeding 16" in diameter. This saw zipped right through them, and wasted no time in doing it. I love this saw, and for 75% of my needs it fits the bill. I still have my 20" gas saw but, if I can use the electric saw for a job, that's what I am using. Great saw!
customer_reviews.author: Charla D.

customer_reviews.title: it  works perfectly for my backyard!
customer_reviews.text: My elderly parents has left the front and backyard unattended. So many unplanned trees grew everywhere. I was able to use this saw to cut down 17 trees with no issue. I was able to cut trees around 6 to 7 inches without any complication. The branches were cut like butter. I am very impressed and it save me $350 from one on the contractor estimate. My only wish is that I wish I went with the battery saw vs electric. It was a pain trying to connect this to an outlet. But I have chosen this electric one is because probably never use this saw again. For the price of $65, its worth every pennies.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Requires assembly
customer_reviews.text: I don't remember that it specifically indicated requiring assembly (attachment of bar and chain.) The instruction manual is very complete with the exception of instructing in the removel of the chain bar cover. I ended up researching the assembly online for guidance. Assembly requires some patience, and it took a total of two hours, including research time. Once together, the chainsaw works well.
customer_reviews.author: Raccoon

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PIECE OF CRAP!!!
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived in a timely manner. In spite of less than minimal instructions, printed in sub-microscopic type, I was able to assemble it. Everything looked great, and I anticipated getting some overdue brush clearing done today. I plugged it in and pressed the trigger. Nothing. Checked the power source, it was fine. Tried again. Nothing. I will admit, it’s a pretty beast, but too large for use as a paperweight. I guess it’s just a doorstop—for which I have precisely zero use. Not good. Not good at all. If I could, I’d give it minus five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Thirdty Beast
customer_reviews.text: Two trees down and no issues, well, a small issue. This thing is a beast, cuts fairly easy through tree trunks 3-5 inches thick. Now to the issue, this thing drinks chain oil like a mother f'r. This is the reason why the 4 stars. Chain is always coated in oil. If you let the saw sit, you will find oil stains on whatever its sitting on. Would I recommend this product, yes. But, make sure you have a good amount of chain oil before you start a large project.
customer_reviews.author: We_got_the_cup_2012

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for 30 minutes
customer_reviews.text: I finally got this out of the box and assembled it for some spring yard work while under quarantine. It worked well for the three large branches for the 30 mins I was using it. Went to use it again to log the branches and it wouldn’t turn on. Checked the cord, the plug, the breaker and still nothing. So it worked well for 30 minutes I guess but I would have to say the price isn’t work the amount of output it gave me.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Mill

customer_reviews.title: Dead out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I have a 15lb paperweight, it won't so much as hum. I wish I would have checked it when it first arrived, but honestly I've never had anything DOA from Amazon so I put it on a shelf until I needed to use it. I'm not going to spend the time to take it all back apart and drain the oil and send it back. I'll just consider this a lesson learned and I'm out $70.
customer_reviews.author: Booker T

customer_reviews.title: Great but needs more bar oil
customer_reviews.text: The saw itself is really as good as any gas powered one of the same size. It was easy to assemble and comes with a larger motor and a better warranty than most others. It is well balanced and handles deftly. The only issue I have is with the amount of bar oil it comes with. There is not enough to use the saw right out of the box according to the instructions. At the time of purchase it should be flagged as needing bar oil so you can buy it then rather than have to run to the local hardware store before using it. That was very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Discerning Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good chainsaw for yard work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 16 inch chainsaw because the biggest tree I needed to cut down in my yard was 14-15 inches thick. This is my first chainsaw. The saw came with the hand guard in the "stop" position, so the saw cannot be started. To enable the saw, you must pull the hand guard all the way back (towards your hand). After I figured this out, it was easy to use. Also, every time I release the trigger, I also push the hand guard forward to disable the saw. In my use, I had to add oil about every half hour. The saw weighs almost 12 pounds; I wish it were lighter (like 10 pounds).
customer_reviews.author: Almaden reader

customer_reviews.title: Great investment!
customer_reviews.text: Had a 150ft tree fall over in someone's yard and have been using this chain saw for about 10 hours total so far gutting it out. Bought an extra Qt of recommended oil (you're going to need it if you got a project like this). This chainsaw has not let me down yet. I have it attached to a 100ft 12AWG extension cord with absolutely no problems. It has a safety device in the front of your left hand and a safety button required to push in order to actuate the start button. Will follow up on review if anything goes south. Buy the warranty, it's like $1 a year, you cheap Ba*****...
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: With my previous chain saw I spent a lit more time fixing the chain than cutting anything, and wrenching on it was a pain in the neck. With this Works chainsaw I haven't yet spent a minute adjusting and never once had to put the chain back on. It's fantastic. It cuts through like butter. I dont push and just let the saw do the cutting and bam...done.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sisemore

customer_reviews.title: lasted 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: it broke, within the first 2 weeks. the safety level wont click anymore. was awesome, was enjoying it, being little it was easy to handle, no kick like bigger chainsaws. I never got over my fear of using the chainsaw before it broke, I know I wasn't misusing it. sucks, now I have to try to go through the insurance I purchased hopefully to get this fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: If you need more saw, hire someone who knows how.
customer_reviews.text: Enough power and size to cut at moderate speed up to 10" logs. More than that requires tact or steel wedges/sledge. Blade is not the sharpest--maybe to satisfy lawyers (reduces kick-back?). More AMPs might blow fuse, so I skipped 18" choice. 100 feet range seems right. Easy to tighten chain. Make sure chain is installed in correct direction. Easy to oil. Blade stops pretty fast when trigger is released. Use expensive chaps, face shield, helmet, and heavy pants and gloves. You will feel over-dressed unless the saw slips. Or a limb does not fall as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Boy was I wrong this saw is great. Yes my wife can use it
customer_reviews.text: I only ordered this because I was injured and would not be able to use my right hand. I thought that my wife could use it until i was able to use my hand and then I would send back the junk electric saw. Boy was I wrong this saw is great. Yes my wife can use it. I was completely amazed. I will be keeping this saw as it really works well. I have and use a stihl 310 and if the cord will reach the electric saw will be my new go-to saw. we have only cut about a rick of wood but unless something breaks it will be one of our best investments.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This thing is just perfect! Strong, easy to use. Adjust the chain tension WITHOUT tools. Just keep the reservoir full of chain oil (it auto feeds the oil as well) and you're off! no tinkering, no mixing gas and oil. No spark plugs. What's not to like? Just get the job done! Love it! Cut down an 18 inch spruce with it the other day. Worked like a charm (see pic)!
customer_reviews.author: Keith L.

customer_reviews.title: Great saw, glad I went electric
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of cutting today for the first time since I received it. Couldn't be happier with the results. Love the quietness, the straight cuts with no mess of gas and oil fill up. Only reason I didn't give it a five star is the distance from the house that I can use it, of course limited to the extension cord. Otherwise and really great saw, should enjoy the use of it for years.
customer_reviews.author: K. Jewell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for a 73 yr
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for a 73 yr. old lady. I have been cutting down lots of baby pines that love to grow on my property. It came completely assembled with instructions for assembling it. It says to clean the chain rail frequently but no instructions on that. or what a chain rail actually is. It took me some time to work out how to remove the chain cover to clean it. Eventually I reversed the instructions for assembly and got the cover off. I just kept adding more and more outdoor extension cords to get where I wanted to go on my 5 acres. Always had enough power even at 800 feet.
customer_reviews.author: M. Leach

customer_reviews.title: Burnt up
customer_reviews.text: Mine was a beast for three cuts then sucked in wood chips and burnt up on the 4th cut. It is a poor design that has openings to the electric motor that can suck in chips and dust. The other electric chainsaw I have, has a sealed motor so this was never a problem. Fortunately, Amazon refunded the entire amount.
customer_reviews.author: Meppert

customer_reviews.title: Short life
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to trim trees/bushes around my house. Worked fine for about a month and on smaller trees/bushes. However chain keeps slipping and difficult to put back. Oil keeps leaking. It was worth it for the money I paid, would have paid more just to cut the trees. So it paid for itself. But at the end, I still had to call a tree service to finish the job once the chain slipped. So yes, worth the money. But no, not long lasting
customer_reviews.author: celamin

customer_reviews.title: Waste of materials and time--never worked
customer_reviews.text: I received this item, tested it in on a dozen different outlets between two houses, ensured that my extension cords were the right gauge and size, and it never started. It's complete junk and the warranty hotline for Worx is some dude's voicemail from what I can tell. Do not buy this. I won't buy ANY WORX products after this experience. Who the heck doesn't perform quality control on a product before shipping?! WORX--that's who.
customer_reviews.author: L. T. Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for money
customer_reviews.text: So far this is great. Got this to clear yard of significant hurricane debris. Decided on electric after son in law wore his arm off trying to start his relatively new gas one. Can't tell you how nice it is to push button and have it start. I have cut up 2 20+ in diameter oak trees as well as several smaller ones. The saw is probably a little slower than a comparable gas, but takes no more effort. Have not noticed the oil running through too fast, but I always thought more was better anyway. Still have a lot of clearing to do, will update if it poops out.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Good, but.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Could use a mechanism to keep cord attached like my weedwacker has. Warning warning warning. My kickback cutout device did not work when the saw kicked back. I had felled the tree, then trimmed it, and was cutting it into logs, so I was bent over. The saw kicked straight back, not up. So it didn't cut me. But it knocked the heck out of both of my shins. And the kickback cutout device never tripped. Might have been due to the angle I was cutting at. But be warned.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M Collins

customer_reviews.title: and it rant like a top
customer_reviews.text: It did not run right out of the box. I took it apart and found the kickback chain brake mechanism was misassembled. The spring is too big for its recess. It took all afternoon, but I got everything right again, and it rant like a top. Sliced through downed limbs and such like butter. Parts are just barely long enough to work. an extra 12/16 or 1/8 to some of these parts inside will allow for metal parts pivoting on plastic studs to loosen but still work. as it, if one of 2 parts loosen this will stop running. Man, it goes through oil. I am glad I bought the gallon and not the quart size.
customer_reviews.author: William M. Steinborn

customer_reviews.title: Oil leaks badly
customer_reviews.text: Chain saw works great, I love operating it. But all the oil drains out to the floor of my shed when I set it on the shelf. Called customer service and they said this was a common problem with chainsaws, that I should 1) loosen the oil cap or maybe 2) empty all the oil out of it after each use. I was hoping for something more like, "Oh we're sorry about that. Let us send you a replacement." Draining the oil after each use is something I was not imagining needing to do when I purchased this chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Great tool to trim trees around the house. It is very powerfull. It is excellent value for the money. I don't mind having the cord if I don't have to miss with pulling the starter, getting gas, and dealing with the noise, fumes of a gas alternative. If I was using it for commercial work I may think otherwise. However, for my back yard needs it perfect
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: An OK Product
customer_reviews.text: The motor is strong, but the chain dulled rather quickly. It also kept clogging at the base of the chain and I had to keep stopping and clearing the twigs. The features questioned about "battery life" but it is an ELECTRIC chain saw so the rating is based partially on strength of motor and lack of sharp chain, clogging. And yes, I kept it full of bar oil so that had nothing to do with the sharp issue or clogging.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, Hassle-Free Chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing efficiency and power, for an electric chainsaw. I do not use a chainsaw a lot, so I'm not interested in the hassle of pull-starts and mixing fuel; as well as the noise. This starts quickly, runs moderately quietly, and tightening the chain tension is simple and without the need of tools. Anything I need to cut, now or in the future, is less than 50-100 feet from an outlet. This chainsaw may not be for everyone, but it does a great job for what I need...and delivery was in two days. Unpacking and assembling were simple and took only a few minutes, without tools; and I was up and running! I would highly recommend this chainsaw!
customer_reviews.author: indianscoach

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I had given up on properly tensioning the chain when I decided to read the manual. What do you know, the saw has a tensioning feature, a sort of dial that you twist until you get the result you want. An excellent saw. A bit heavy for me but gives a smooth, quick cut. I also learned that it is a good idea to check on the tension after each cut and adjusting if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for what it is.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good unit and powerful for what it is. It seems to guzzle oil. May be they are all the same, not sure but that little reservoir only lasts a few minutes. I guess if you just chop a small branch that's OK. The chain came off once and it took me a while to figure it out how to place it on again but this was my first time with a chain saw. It definitely gets the job done for small projects. I would not become a lumberjack and use it though.
customer_reviews.author: MLG

customer_reviews.title: For the price I think you couldn't do better. I brought down my 25 foot
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to chain saws so this is a novice review. For the price I think you couldn't do better. I brought down my 25 foot, 18-inch diameter trunk ash tree with this chainsaw and had no issues. Requires occasional chain tightening and uses quite a bit of chain lube. While cutting through the trunk I had some chain slowdown but I don't really think that's abnormal for a cord-powered chainsaw. For under $150 this thing performed spectacularly and I recommend it for light to moderate, or occasional, work. It was perfect for what I needed to do.
customer_reviews.author: WickerCat

customer_reviews.title: this is an amazing tool for $75 dollars
customer_reviews.text: this is an amazing tool for $75 dollars. the 100 ft. cord for it (10 gauge, 15 amps) cost $85 (and it was worth it). the instruction manual was a little shaky but the orange plastic housing comes off if you just loosen the big black knob all the way. doesn't say anywhere in there to do it though. don't forget to pull back the stop in the front. cuts very well, uses oil but not excessively (check maybe every other use). turner ace hardware near me will sharpen the chain (removed from the saw) for $6 with a day turnaround so maybe an extra chain? what a deal!
customer_reviews.author: isaac bickerstaff

customer_reviews.title: One of my best investments to date
customer_reviews.text: One of my best investments to date. Got an extra chain and have taken down two 40 foot trees very easily (not counting that I am an out of shape 65 year old, I have to hot tub every night. Moving logs is not my hobby). I have been bragging about this saw to everyone I know. The arborists gave me an estimate of $2400.00. I think I saved a few bucks, even if you factor in a few tubes of Ben Gay!
customer_reviews.author: The West

customer_reviews.title: Great, easy to handle little work horse for yard cleanup!
customer_reviews.text: We had a small tornado that didn't touch down but managed to RIP out and knock over a bunch of trees and this little chainsaw was a lifesaver! Hubby and I (I'm 5 ft.3) were both able to use this thing to saw the trees I to smaller movable logs and branches and clean up what a tree removal company wanted 5-6k to remove. I put the thing together having never touched a chainsaw before in my life and learned how to use it watching a youtube video. Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Clare from Greensboro

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a homeowner.
customer_reviews.text: This Electric Chainsaw is perfect for my needs. You're not going to be able to take down a redwood or even a health sized oak, but honestly I lack the skill and experience to take down a 12" diameter tree. But with a little bit of care this chainsaw can easily handle an 8 " diameter tree. You don't have to worry about a battery running down, and it's safer and quieter than a gas chainsaw.There's not a lot of kickback. I've previously owned a comparable Homelite chainsaw. This one is easier to assemble and easier to maintain. As always read the entire manual before operating it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cameron Calkins

customer_reviews.title: Only used once, but glad I had it.
customer_reviews.text: Was tasked with removing a 20’ spruce. About 14” at the base. Made easy work of the job. I don’t have enough work to justify a gas saw. Had good luck with other Worx products so I took a chance. Went through the 14” trunk way better than I expected. As long as you have access to power and a good extension cord that can carry the amps, the saw is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: JFt

customer_reviews.title: Great product for occasional yard use. Simple & Powerful.
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Had to remove a dead 11" diameter solid hardwood that was too close to house, and this did the job no problem. It even cut the entire 40' tree into firewood sections without having to stop. Easy assembly. Auto tightening. Easy oil fill. Simple. No gas mess or gummed up engine to worry about as it sits unused for many months at a time. Great tool to have on hand for the occasional around the yard chainsaw needs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael V.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little Saw, powerful and cuts smoothly!
customer_reviews.text: The first of these chain saws that I purchased had to be sent back because I could adjust the tensioner tight enough. The second saw was just fine, I could see the flaw in manufacturing when compared side by side. This little saw has enough power to cut through an old oak tree without any problem. For my occasional use this little guy fits the bill, ant thing that it can't handle get hired out.
customer_reviews.author: GraflexTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for the first hour of using it
customer_reviews.text: Got this to remove part of an old stump in the yard. Worked fine for the first hour of using it. Didn't use it the entire hour. Went to finish it the second time today and blade seems dull already and is barely cutting anything.
customer_reviews.author: Sandoceansun

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: The chainsaw is a great size for townhouse yards! However, the instructions need to be clearer regarding ’how to start’. Please let the manufacturer know it needs clearer instructions as first needed is to unlock the ‘brake’. (Pull the protection hand guard toward the handle to unlock).
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Great chainsaw for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great chainsaw for the price. I love the auto-tensioning build into the product. Oil is easy to add and the instruction were very clear. Comfortable to hold. Only gave it 4 stars because I used it one day and it already needs to be sharpened so I need to buy a sharpening kit for $16 because it doesn't come with sharpening tools. They should mention the sharpening part on the website or include the file with the saw. Overall very happy with it and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Dunder

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this chainsaw. To be honest it took me two weeks before I used it because I was a little scared. My dad (having 3 daughters) taught us how to use all his power tools and we are all quite handy with the tools. I chose the electric chainsaw because I didn't want to worry about gas, oil etc. This was very easy to use. I ended up taking down 5 trees (3 for my neighbor) and a wooden gate. The pricing was perfect - because lets face it once you cut down what you want it's not going to be used that much. I would recommend this product to anyone. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: lad

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny...
customer_reviews.text: Worx very well for an electric chainsaw. My cousin destroyed it cutting into roots and dirt, but I will fix it up. Consider the amount of abuse it took I am really impressed that it even turns on. Poor little cutting machine! The one item to note is the auto-tensioner. Read the instructions on how to REMOVE the auto-tensioner. If you just keep turning to take it off, the tensioner breaks. Support told me to please read the manual and to note that to remove the tensioner you need to pull out and unscrew. It's a good saw.
customer_reviews.author: DouggieFresh

customer_reviews.title: Low priced low budget saw
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the saw in 2014 knowing it was not going to be a heavy duty saw. I used saw about six times, and pushed it to its limit four times. I am throwing it away and buying another saw, different brand. Mechanism for adjusting chain was somewhat troublesome.
customer_reviews.author: Dave, Orland Park, IL

customer_reviews.title: Recommended, well-designed for non-pros
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly, easy to assemble, and I have used it once (so far) to cut down stumps left from overgrown shrub removal. The biggest was about 9 inches across and the saw went through it handily with steady power. The unit is a little heavier than I wanted, ideally, but I trusted the high reviews. It is well-designed and not difficult to use for a cautious novice clearing overgrowth along a yard perimeter. It's not horribly noisy and the safety features are good.
customer_reviews.author: rb in columbia, sc

customer_reviews.title: Tons of power but be careful always be checking the chain tensioner.
customer_reviews.text: Tons of power - Could be five star product but the very easy to use blade holder/chain tensioner came loose when using it so this could be a very easily turn this into dangerous minus 5 star product as it represents a real dangerous issue of having the chain coming loose and flying off if not checked for proper tension on a constant basis as there was no real locking mechanism other than the tension of a hand screw knob to hold it in place. Anti kickback chain stop safety lever works almost too good. Nice if there was a better indicator to flash or show clearly that it is activated.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan R. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Happy Camper
customer_reviews.text: Customer service is outstanding. I had ordered this saw, and ended up with a defective product. I could only attach the arm (which the chain goes around) upside down. Worx is sending me a new arm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Chainsaw. A+ Design and Power!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely Love This Chainsaw. It's sturdy, does a great job and I enjoy using it. I'm 5' 7" 130lbs, and even though I was initially intimidated with the machine, I decided to give it a try, now I love it. It's cut through 8" tree branches and I only had to add more oil. It's not a flimsy light machine, it's heavier than I expected, yet it cuts through branches in lightening speed that my gardener fails to see. I never thought I'd be excited about a chainsaw, but I am with this one, it has no smelly GAS odor since it's electric and I'm happy. Thanks to some reviewers who help me choose this machine, much appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: SY214Top Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Defect in design
customer_reviews.text: Expectations of power is good. There is a big problem with the "toolless" auto tensioning blade tightening mechanism,after certain time during use blade gets loose and if you do not catch it in time blade comes flying off bar, in 2-3 hours of cutting this happened to me 4-5 times. I learned to foresee it,but it clearly is a defect in design, could be potentially dangerous, would rather have to stop and retighten like the good old days. I have been would cutting for 40 years including using a 48" chainsaw mill and 36" saw back in the day, I just wanted a non gas for property maintenance, like the power
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence D. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: The saw is great ,the Instructions not  detailed enough
customer_reviews.text: Received On Saturday , tried several times to use on Sunday the Lock bar came stuck in the Locked Position ,On Monday I was getting ready to send it back , So i gave The Lock bar a Very hard Pull so it would start, it did ,But it took me Four attempts to get the Chain tight enough not to fall off. It cuts great , I cut down a twenty foot tall dead cherry plum tree about 5in diameter ,a 25 foot dead limb of a live tree & cut up all to fit in our recycled bin.If they want Five stars greatly improve the Instructions !
customer_reviews.author: Dannie D. Crowder

customer_reviews.title: Did you know chainsaws are fun?
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with our purchase. Had a yard that needed some serious help. Our first chainsaw purchase and we are loving it. Easy to use. Cut through tree limbs with ease. Being a beginner it felt simple to set up and navigate safely. Actual fun cutting stuff up!
customer_reviews.author: Libra Lady 78

customer_reviews.title: Great for light duty yard work
customer_reviews.text: I cut down about 12 trees that had stumps around 6" dia. with this. Some comments mentioned the tightener working loose. I had that issue a bit but just made sure to keep tightening/checking it and it wasn't a problem. I liked the hand brake safety feature. I prefer the electric chainsaw over a gas powered since I use it so infrequently.
customer_reviews.author: BMiller

customer_reviews.title: The automatic oil system is perfect. I have cut too smaller trees down and ...
customer_reviews.text: I owned another electric chain saw for years and I always found it a bother when the chain came loose or I forgot to oil the chain bar. With this WORX chain saw, I do not have to worry about either. The adjustment knob only takes a few seconds to tighten rather having to take it all apart and fight to tighten up the chain. The automatic oil system is perfect. I have cut too smaller trees down and cut them up without worrying about the oil. Just needed to look at the window and when it got low, just needed to stop for a couple of minutes to fill it up and then back to work. EXCELLANT PURCHASE!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Many Parts Discontinued
customer_reviews.text: The saw is now about five years old and has performed well until recently when the saw wouldn't stop running. I traced the problem to the internal switch. Unfortunately, that part and several other critical parts are no longer available rendering the saw useless. It is beyond me why the central part to the operation of the saw has been discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Good for camping or cabin
customer_reviews.text: Cut wood for hours with this saw, used a 2000 watt Smarter Tools generator and it worked fine. I thought I needed to parallel two generators together, but decided to try the saw with one generator and discipovered it worked. It quit once, so I pulled the chain and bar off, cleaned out the oil and punky wood debris, then it fired right back up. Most of the wood I cut was half rotten, some was good oak. It works well for my purpose and I am very pleased. No gas to worry about getting bad, I can just use it and forget it when I don't need it.
customer_reviews.author: Marta SolitaireTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great product, crappy turnout.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband as a Christmas gift. Arrived without a shipping box and we pull pull in from work he sees it just setting there. It’s not in a shipping box whatsoever and out for everyone to see in the open. (Which I understand was the drivers fault.) Thank God we live in the country so it wasn’t stolen while we were at work. Chainsaw is great, boxing for shipping not so much. The one thing I wanted to get him the most was ruined because of no shipping box. Oh well what do ya do right? Seller, a shipping box would be nice for future references.
customer_reviews.author: ChelseaBaker

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought my husband this saw, we tried it out when we got it and the. Put it away till spring. When we went to get it out last month all the oil had drained out through the seam in the casing. I contacted customer support...twice...and zero response! They don’t care about their customers, and the saw is a piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: Penelope

customer_reviews.title: Works very well. Keep the oil tank at the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Keep the oil tank at the proper levels, stay away from small flimsy branches, they can get pulled into the chain drive area and do some damage to plastic and chain tension mechanism. If you're vigilant, this saw as well as the chain itself, should last a long time. Tip: when you stop to refill the oil tank, first remove the tensioning knob and cover to clean out the oily debris, re-secure the cover and knob, then refill the oil tank. Ready to go for another hour of use.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: It works well enough for light jobs like saplings, but no replacement for gas
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to be harsh. It works well enough for light jobs like saplings, but no replacement for gas. I have a Worx weedeater that I've been very happy with so when my gas Polan gave out I figured i'd try the saw. I used it on pine branches, maple branches, and some large bush roots but eventually gave up. It felt like I was cutting with a very fine blade hand saw. So I Actually switched to my reciprocating saw and cut them in half the time. Plus the chain kept coming lose and you need some loooong extension cords. There's really no substitute for a gas powered saw.
customer_reviews.author: Go Blue

customer_reviews.title: Wowie!! Fells trees like butter! Great product for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: This product delivered as promised and was a beast in felling multiple trees in the course of an afternoon. Lightweight for power and was able to get through various types of wood without issue. It does use a considerable amount of chain oil but beyond that it is a great powerful little machine. This a is a high recommedn for the price and is perfect for any weekend warrior looking to clean some areas around your property. I cannot speak to duarabilty but for 4hrs of straight cutting it did the job beautifully! great bang for the buck!!
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: That's the only bad thing-trailing the cord but it becomes an afterthought after ...
customer_reviews.text: I had not used an electric chainsaw before but chose this for convenience in cutting the occasional backyard tree. This thing is a beast! No more changing the oil and dealing with gas. So I did end up cutting into an extension cord, but chalk that up to getting used to it. That's the only bad thing-trailing the cord but it becomes an afterthought after a while. It cuts through 10inch maple very easily. Just be careful since it makes no noise but is ready to go with a squeeze of the trigger. Great features include the self tightening chain and safety brake. Nice tool.
customer_reviews.author: P. Cyr

customer_reviews.title: JUNK product
customer_reviews.text: just open the box today to cut some small trees in my back yard only to cut one and a half inch tree it took 20 minutes and the chain fell off a few times, dangerous an a terrible product my anvil did a much better job, my mistake no to use it right a way when I got it.
customer_reviews.author: simon D

customer_reviews.title: It works as well as a gas without the maintenance
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. I lost the first due to a flood and mud had gotten into it. Other than the oil leak, which, if you just pour the extra back into the bottle after use, this thing does awesome. There's little maintenance and it cuts as good as a gas powered. Just use a heavy cord rated at 15amps. It's cut trees and branches all day long. And the chain can be replaced with the Oregon brand.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S

customer_reviews.title: It's been a good saw so far
customer_reviews.text: My first electric saw, I've used it for at least four hours over a few weekends, cleaning up fallen trees and limbs after our 2nd March Nor'easter. I had to drop a tree eighteen inches thick (two more than the blade) and it did the job. Half as heavy as a gas powered machine, quieter (I don't need ear cups) and less messy without the gas/oil mix. The electric cord does get tangled in the brush, and you will absolutely need to buy the quart of chain oil, the little sample you get with the saw will last maybe 5 minutes. It's been a good saw so far.
customer_reviews.author: Fallingwaters

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a smaller gas power chainsaw. I have a large gas chainsaw and purchased this for the smaller (less then say 8" logs) logs as a way to avoid mixing gas etc for the smaller jobs. I cut about an 1/8 of a cord today and it cut like a charm, the logs were less than 8" diameter. Only 4 stars because the safety lever up front kept tripping (turning off) the chainsaw at the very slightest touch. I recommend buying extra oil and a blade when you purchase this. FYI....I was using a 25' extension cord and NEVER tripped the breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Lost in PA

customer_reviews.title: LOG eater
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this chain saw. Went through 10-12" diam logs like a laser. Plenty of power. Keep an eye on the oil reservoir because it does use oil. I bought this when my last 2 Macs finally said that 15 years was enough. Screw that oil and gas, varnished carbs every year. No more !! Great for the amount of use I will need it for. About 2-3 times every fall. Chain was still very sharp after about 2 hours of use. NowI know I can just grab it, plug it in, add some bar oil and go.
customer_reviews.author: fonepwr

customer_reviews.title: Certified Junk!
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw failed the first day I was using it after the fourth cut. It was still under manufacturer's warranty. Worx was great in honoring the warranty and sent me a new saw, after I paid $19.24 in shipping. Out of the box the replacement saw failed to work! Dead; no hum, no noise at all. I asked for for a refund on my original saw as well as the shipping for my second saw. I'm sure 'll get neither. My apologies for the quality of the attached video, but I had to make the file as small as possible to keep it from being too large to upload.
customer_reviews.author: kcs

customer_reviews.title: easy to operate, well balanced, effective and safe
customer_reviews.text: I used it to take down a dying melaleuca tree that was about two feet across at the base, and it chewed through without a problem. I've never held a chainsaw in my hands before this one, but I am familiar with other types of power tools. This chainsaw is easy to operate, well balanced, effective and safe. I love how the chain stops immediately when the trigger is released.
customer_reviews.author: Alessandro Dona

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Weekend Gardeners
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tool for two years now. I just replaced the chain for my semi annual crepe murder ritual. Flawless. Low noise. No fuss and plenty of power for 5" limb cuts. Keep the oil reservoir topped up and replace the chain now and then. Otherwise......zero maintenance. Perfect for the lazy weekend gardener.
customer_reviews.author: Stan McCord

customer_reviews.title: Worked for awhile
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for awhile. After 1 1/2 years it stopped. 3 year warranty, gonna be fun having to ship it somewhere for repairs. Warranty repair won't return my emails...still have 3 1/2 years left on warranty...buy locally.
customer_reviews.author: Cactus Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great potential but sprung an oil leak... twice
customer_reviews.text: I used this chainsaw 1 time but I did it one time with two different versions. I got the first one, loved using it. Put is down for a week and when I picked it back up the oil was all over my floor. I sent it back to get a replacement and the EXACT SAME THING happened. I loved using the saw and it worked great, but either I had terrible luck or there is a terrible design flaw in the device. I didn't give them 1 star because they replaced it the first time and refunded after the 2nd. I will be purchasing and Ego cordless now.
customer_reviews.author: spencer martin

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lady fall and never got to use it. It seemed solidly built and I was happy with the purchase. Finally got to use it today to cut down a rose of sharon, nothing big. One cut and the chain loosens up and falls off. Fix it...now have chain oil all over my hands. Do another cut chain falls off again. Not happy. Time to quit for the day.
customer_reviews.author: Keywestmama

customer_reviews.title: Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: I am a woman and I love my worx weed eater. I must tell you this worx chainsaw works like a champ also! It is clearly not intended to cut down big trees but it works great on branches on trees that need it. I thought it was broke just like the other ones when the chain fell off, but I actually fixed it in less than 10 minutes! It was so easy! I love how Worx uncomplicates tools and makes it easy for people to get their yards done without asking for someone to come over with their gas tools to do something so simple!
customer_reviews.author: vickie judkins

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Worse chainsaw I have ever used. I've been using chainsaws since I was a young teen. Now over 70, I know chainsaws. The self tightening feature does not work The chain kept jumping off the bar, so I had to tighten it by hand. It didn't take long before the chain stretched and was too big for the bar. It would cost a small fortune to keep replacing the chain. It's to late to return it so I'm stuck with an unusable saw. Lesson learned. Don't by a WORX!
customer_reviews.author: D. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: Received the Worx chain saw about a month ago. I was able to assemble the chain without any difficulty. I have used the product to cut many small bushes and experienced no problems. Probably not good to use on large trees or large branches. The Worx chain saw is easy to maneuver and is reasonably light weight. The 16 inch bar is perfect for home projects. The chain saw does not come with oil. I purchased a bottle of oil from Amazon for around eight dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing part
customer_reviews.text: I am going to reorder another and try one more time. It came with blade unassembled. Instruction stink. I tried and tried to put it on but after looking at the cheap owners manual I discovered a part missing where the chain attaches in the back that makes it tighten up. Only a metal stud sticking up with nothing to attach the chain to. After a not very helpful customer service call I just returned it to Amazon. Thankfully it was within the time frame. I hope the replacement I am ordering comes with all of the parts or I'm done with Worx.
customer_reviews.author: Linda C. Barnes

product_meta.title: Worx WG303.1, 14.5 Amp 16-inch Corded Electric Chainsaw with Auto-Tension, Chain Brake
product_meta.description: The WORX 16” 3.5 HP 14.5 Amp chainsaw is a cut above the rest. For starters, the exclusive WORX patented tool-free chain replacement and auto-tensioning system eliminates the headaches faced with most other chainsaws – no lumberjack experience necessary to operate this chainsaw! The auto-tension system includes a single, oversized knob that automatically secures the bar and chain and maintains proper tension while you’re working. The auto-tensioning system also extends bar and chain life by eliminating any chance of over-tightening. What's more, all-metal dogs at the base of the 16” bar help add stability during cutting, while an easy-to-lubricate sprocket on the bar nose helps preserve the life of the tool. Powerful enough for your toughest jobs, WORX electric chainsaws produce anywhere from 3.5 peak horsepower. The WORX 16” chainsaw also offers gas-free, hassle-free operation. Different from gas-powered chain saws, this electric chainsaw doesn't require you to mix oil and gas or deal with difficult startups. And unlike the competition, WORX features an automatic oiler that provides constant lubrication to both the bar and chain along with a 6.75-ounce oil reservoir with an oil level indicator. Designed for safety and comfort, this WORX chainsaw includes a built-in safety chain brake that stops the chain in seconds whenever improper contact is made, protecting you in the event of kickback. Additionally, a rubber over-molded rear handle and ergonomic full-wrap front handle let you work in full control and comfort.
feature_bullets: 14.5 Amp motor output delivers a cutting performance similar to gas chainsaws for home owners, farmers, and ranchers
Patented auto tension chain system prevents over tightening; stays at the right tension for hundreds of uses
Low kickback bar and built in chain brake for added safety; This model does not Include a battery; This is an electric tool; Chain speed : 12 meter per second; Rated voltage : 120V to 60Hz
Automatic oil lubrication and built in oil reservoir with window level indicator and chain pitch is 3/8 inch, chain gauge is 0.05 inch, oil tank capacity is 200 milliliter

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars2,234 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
